meanings.definition: Relating to or involving only one parent.
meanings.sent1: The uniparental family consisted of just a mother and her child.
meanings.sent2: The uniparental care provided by the mother was essential for the baby's well-being.
meanings.sent3: It was a uniparental household, with the mother juggling work and parenting.
meanings.sent4: The uniparental decision to adopt a pet brought joy to the family.
meanings.sent5: The uniparental bond between mother and child was unbreakable.

meanings.definition: Inheriting genetic material from only one parent.
meanings.sent1: The uniparental inheritance of the gene explained the unique trait in the offspring.
meanings.sent2: The uniparental genetic mutation was passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The uniparental DNA test revealed surprising results about the family tree.
meanings.sent4: The uniparental genetic code was responsible for the rare disease.
meanings.sent5: The uniparental genetic link between them was undeniable.
